result.execSummary:
The defendant Gerald Lynn Berry was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Attempt Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).
  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Pay DNA surcharge plus costs and disbursements.  Defendant given one year to pay by 4/8/16.  Failure to pay would result in a civil judgment.
Court waived costs as to count one only, and did not assess additional costs or surcharges.
Credit of 10 days.  TIME SERVED DISPOSITION.
Court ordered costs as to count one only and did not access additional costs or surcharges.
Credit of 7 days.  TIME SERVED DISPOSITION.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Gerald Lynn Berry

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: No reason as to why costs/surcharges waived on count two on the record. Assessed per Directive.

/of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief, filed with:
Pretrial Incarceration Credit form.

Plea hearing proceeds.  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, and further advised that if not a United States citizen deportation is possible. Defendant sworn, examined as to plea, and entered a plea of guilty.  Court found defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived all constitutional rights. Plea questionnaire waiver of rights and addendum to plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulated to the criminal complaint as factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty of Counts 1 and 2 as charged in the Amended Information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered into the record.   

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  The Court imposed the following:

AS TO COUNT 01:
The Court imposed the 10 days at the House of Correction, with credit for 10 days; TIME SERVED DISPOSITION.
Court ordered defendant pay the DNA surcharge plus costs and disbursements.  Defendant given one year to pay (by 4/08/16).  Failure to pay would result in a civil judgment.

AS TO COUNT 02:
The Court imposed 7 days at the House of Correction, with credit for 7 days; TIME SERVED DISPOSITION.
Court ordered costs as to Count 1 only and did not assess additional costs or surcharges.

Filed,
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief;
Pretrial Incarceration Credit form.

Defendant Gerald Lynn Berry in court with attorney Gary Edward Rosenthal.  Defendant Gerald Lynn Berry in custody.  Deann L Heard appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Amended Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty for purposes of arraignment; will proceed with a guilty plea on today's date.

/submitted by the State, received and filed.  Defendant is now charged as follows:

COUNT 01:
Attempt Theft (Value Not Exceeding $2,500), an attempt to commit a Class A Misdemeanor, contrary to Wis. Stats. section 943.20(1)(a) and (3)(a), and 939.32.

AS TO COUNT 02:
Disorderly Conduct, a Class B Misdemeanor, contrary to Wis. Stats. section 947.01(1).
Pretrial Release Conditions Order, signed and filed.
Arguments heard as to bail.  Court set bail at $1,000.00 cash with TOT to Justice Point: no firearms or weapons; no drugs or alcohol; No Contact Order with Juana G. and Park East Hotel remains.

Attorney Gary Edward Rosenthal in court, defendant Gerald Lynn Berry not in court, in custody.  Deann L Heard appeared by telephone for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant returned on the warrant.  Defense counsel requested a plea date.  Plea hearing scheduled for April 8, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Bench warrant cleared by Milwaukee County Sheriff on 3/26/15.  Bench Warrant filed.  Case is adjourned for return on bench warrant in Branch 20 on 3/31/15 at 8:30 a.m.  Attorney Rosenthal and ADA Heard notified of same.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE JUDGE ON RETURN OF THE BENCH WARRANT.
Defendant Gerald Lynn Berry not in court.    Defendant failing to appear, Court lifted the stay and ordered the Bench Warrant to be issued.

Attorney Gary Edward Rosenthal in court.  Kimberly Dorice Schoepp appeared on behalf of DeAnn L. Heard for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense counsel indicated that his client is ill and does not appear; requested that the court issue but stay a warrant to the next date.  State does not object.  Court issued but stayed a bench warrant to the next date.  Scheduling conference scheduled for March 20, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Gerald Lynn Berry in court with attorney Gary Edward Rosenthal.  Deann L Heard appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense counsel requested another scheduling date.  File retained in court.  All terms and conditions ordered to continue.  Scheduling conference scheduled for March 5, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Certification of transcript of proceedings of PRELIMINARY HEARING commencing 02/04/2014 received and filed. (14 Pages)
Copy of transcript forwarded to Atty. Gary Rosenthal, 1207 E. Buffalo Street, Suite 509, Milwaukee, WI, 53202.

Defendant Gerald Lynn Berry in court with attorney Gary Edward Rosenthal.  Antoni Apollo for Deann L Heard appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state:Javier Cornejo-MPD Officer.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and pleads not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 20.  Scheduling conference scheduled for February 19, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Gerald Lynn Berry in court with attorney Darryl E. Smith.  Ronald Dague for Deann L Heard appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
Motion of the defense counsel to withdraw granted by the Court.   Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for Preliminary Hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 4, 2015 at 08:30 am.

No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.
  Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with PARK EAST HOTEL, 916 E STATE ST., MILWAUKEE, WI AND JUANA G.
  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Gerald Lynn Berry in court with attorney Darryl E. Smith.  Defendant Gerald Lynn Berry in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge MORONEY, Branch 20.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for January 27, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
